font.font: The 2019 - 2023 Bethlehem-Center School District Comprehensive Plan has been approved by PDE and can be found in the tab above.

font.i: Striving to be a great place to work and even better place to learn

font.b: Planned instruction resumes tomorrow. Students with internet access must log into all of their Google Classrooms each day at any time, but teachers can only be reached during their regular scheduled class time. Attendance the first week will be used daily to identify the number of students that will need packets. It's very important for students to log into their classrooms daily. Those without access must call / email the teacher for a copy of packets to complete. We will be reaching out to families midweek for students that have not logged in. Details for packet pickup and completed packet drop off details will be sent midweek.

Please review the attached letter that outlines our planned instruction for distance learning effective Monday. Have a safe and healthy weekend. High school students should email their teachers if they do not have access to Google Classroom or request an equivalent packet.

Tomorrow will be Flexible Instructional Day #2. Students should complete activity #2 in the FID packet provided by the teachers. Please use your computer or toll free number / PIN to contact your teacher during the assigned times if you need assistance with your work.
Beginning tomorrow all children residing in the district between the ages 2 to 18 are eligible for free meals. Pickups are on Mondays and Thursdays form 11 to noon at the following locations:

Reminder students will be completing their FID packets for Days 1-3 beginning Wednesday. A message will go out Friday with directions for next week. Teachers are currently creating packets and Google Classroom for planned instruction to begin next week. Please complete the link for the Technology Survey as we are planning how many paper copies of content to deliver. Paper copies of the survey have been delivered to the food pickup locations for distribution on Thursday. Please see attached FAPE letter for all families of the district

We are happy to attach a letter from Atlantic Broadband offering two months of free internet and equipment to support qualified families during the closure. This is intended to help students get access to distance learning. Our Technology Director is also currently working on preparing all district laptop computers and devices for delivery to families in need. On Monday, a link to a technology survey will be sent to everyone through Remind. Additionally, paper copies will be available at lunch pickup locations throughout the district. Please see the offer.

Please take a look at the attached letter from our Superintendent that contains updates and the plan for utilizing Flexible Instructional Days (Phase 1) next week. The "Continuity of Education Plan" is being finalized to cover the education of our students beyond April 3rd. Thank you all for your patience and understanding during this crisis.

div.span: Please be advised that the Bethlehem-Center School District will be closing school effective after today Friday, March 13, 2020. We plan a two week closure while we monitor developments of the health crisis. Please check our website for updated details. Flexible Instructional Days will not be used until they are announced on TV channels sometime AFTER the first week. We will also use Remind App to communicate regularly. Thank you for your patience as developments are rapidly changing. Stay safe and healthy!

div.font: All after school athletics and extra-curricular activities have been suspended. There will be no use of facilities outside of regular educational purposes.

font.b: has been postponed until further notice
